content.description: Getting off the ground gets your attention and the rest is better than it looks.  To top it off the rock is solid except near the top where you stay right to avoid the funk.
content.location: Starts a few feet left of Grain Dance and follows a crack up into a neat stemming groove.

content.description: This climb follows a crack that takes pro almost everywhere you want it.  Unfortunately the first half has a ton of crispy rock making it a route I would only recommend if you want a strong mental challenge.  It is too bad the route will get so little traffic as it would be good if it cleaned up.
content.protection: Doubles from stoppers to Yellow Camalot.
content.location: Located on the Second Silo, this route is on the center section and follows the obvious right angling crack/seam over a bulge to a chimney that is right of the highest point of the wall.

content.description: This climb follows a crack that takes pro almost everywhere you want it. Unfortunately the first half has a ton of crispy rock making it a route I would only recommend if you want a strong mental challenge. It also has a committing move to a bulge with a crack through it.  It is too bad the route will get so little traffic as it would be better if it cleaned up.
content.location: This climb is on the Second Silo.  It climbs the same crack as Grain Dance but just past the red Camalot placement you bust left on a thin finger rail and climb face to crack through the roof then continue up the center of the tallest part of the wall.

content.description: Rarely visited due to the less than ideal rock.  A lot of potato chip flakes on the lower half of most of the routes.  With enough traffic this would improve but since there are not that many routes and few sport routes this probably will not happen.
